about.headline: About Me
short_paragraphs: I am a Computer Vision & Machine Learning Engineer with end-to-end experience: from research prototypes in NeRF, diffusion models and incremental learning to production deployments on edge hardware and enterprise GenAI platforms.

My recent work focuses on building multimodal systems that combine 2D/3D vision, language models, and agentic workflows. I enjoy turning ambiguous problem statements into measurable, data-driven solutions with clear success metrics.

Beyond engineering, I actively mentor students and early-career professionals, maintain a strong technical presence on LinkedIn, and continuously explore new ideas at the intersection of optimization, vision, and generative modeling.

thesis.title: Smart Routing Algorithms for Pickup and Delivery Operations by Enhancing Capacity Utilization
thesis.summary: A data-driven framework for capacitated vehicle routing with pickup and delivery, integrating driver preferences and spatiotemporal features using Markov Models and LSTMs.
thesis.problem: Classical vehicle routing often under-utilizes capacity and ignores driver behaviour and time-varying demand patterns, leading to suboptimal fuel and labor usage.
approach: Modeled pickup and delivery operations as a Markov Decision Process with LSTM-based demand forecasting to capture temporal dependencies.
Proposed heuristic and learning-augmented routing strategies that balance route optimality with practical constraints such as driver preferences and real-world variability.
impact: Achieved 1.5–2x higher serving capacity compared to traditional routing baselines.
Maintained deviation under 20% from optimal paths while improving cost-effectiveness and reliability.
Quantified trade-offs between vehicle size, simultaneous pickups/deliveries and number of stops on fleet size and capacity limits.

Agentic & Tool-using Systems: LlamaIndex for knowledge graphs and retrieval

projects.title: AI-Powered PowerPoint Generation with DALL-E Integration
projects.problem: Manual corporate presentation creation is time-consuming (4-8 hours), expensive ($200-500/deck), and requires costly stock images ($50-200/image) while struggling to maintain consistent brand styling.
approach: Developed LangGraph state machine orchestration for multi-step presentation generation with human-in-the-loop approval workflow.
Integrated Azure OpenAI DALL-E 3 for real-time AI image generation with intelligent prompt engineering for brand-aligned visual content.
Built automated color theming engine that dynamically applies company brand colors as gradient/solid overlays on AI-generated images with configurable transparency.
Created natural language background styling allowing users to specify styling in plain English (e.g., 'circular background on left with 30% opacity') parsed and applied by LLM.
Implemented custom HTML-to-PPTX rich text converter preserving bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, and code formatting.
Developed advanced image processing suite with 15+ effects: circular/rectangular masks, rounded corners, opacity, blur, brightness, contrast, saturation, grayscale, sepia, color inversion.
impact: Reduced presentation creation time by ~95% (from 4-8 hours to 5-10 minutes).
Achieved ~99% reduction in design costs (~$0.50 API cost vs $200-500 traditional).
Reduced image licensing costs by ~97% ($0.04-0.08/image vs $50-200).
Enabled 100% automated brand consistency vs manual QC.
Projected enterprise ROI of $100,000-$300,000/year for 500 decks/year.

projects.title: NeRF-based 3D Interior Reconstruction
projects.problem: Need for accurate 3D reconstruction of indoor environments using only monocular RGB footage to support virtual walkthroughs and precise equipment installation.
approach: Built a pipeline combining COLMAP-based Structure-from-Motion for camera pose estimation with NeRF training for continuous 3D scene representation.
Experimented with different sampling strategies, loss functions and NeRF variants to improve reconstruction for low-texture surfaces like plain walls.
impact: Enabled high-fidelity 3D reconstructions from simple camera scans without depth sensors.
Improved reconstruction robustness on challenging indoor scenes via custom regularization and training schedules.
Reduced training time by ~25% using mixed-precision and scene-aware hyperparameter tuning.

projects.title: Face-Landmark Guided Image Generation
projects.problem: Need fine-grained control over face pose and expression while retaining identity in generated or edited facial images.
approach: Used Stable Diffusion with ControlNets conditioned on facial landmarks and depth maps to steer pose and expression.
Designed evaluation metrics based on landmark distance and LPIPS to quantify identity preservation vs. controllability trade-offs.
impact: Delivered controllable face generation demos for internal stakeholders, enabling quick what-if variations for visual concepts.
Provided a reusable pipeline for future face editing and anonymization workflows.

projects.title: Edge Deployed Unsafe Driving Behaviour Detection
projects.problem: Detect unsafe driving behaviours (phone usage, drowsiness, no seatbelt) in real-time on constrained edge devices for fleets.
approach: Developed multi-task CNN-based models for detecting multiple unsafe behaviours from driver-facing camera feeds.
Optimized the model using OpenVINO and quantization for deployment on low-power edge hardware.
Designed alerting logic that balances sensitivity with alert fatigue by combining temporal smoothing and multi-label thresholds.
impact: Achieved 83% reduction in model size while maintaining accuracy and reaching 60 FPS on edge devices.
Improved driver safety insights and built a foundation for fleet-wide analytics dashboards.

projects.title: Incremental Object Detection with Knowledge Distillation
projects.problem: Extend object detectors with new classes over time without catastrophic forgetting of previously trained classes.
approach: Implemented a two-stage training strategy with feature-level and logit-level distillation from a frozen teacher model.
Compared against naive fine-tuning and rehearsal-based baselines on internal datasets and COCO-like splits.
impact: Maintained ~85% mAP on old classes while adding new categories, close to full retraining performance.
Reduced retraining costs and made incremental updates more practical for evolving datasets.

projects.title: Vision-Language Extraction from Engineering Drawings
projects.problem: Manually understanding and transcribing dimensions, tolerances and metadata from complex engineering drawings is slow and error-prone.
approach: Combined layout-aware OCR with detectors for arrows, callouts and key geometric elements in drawings.
Used a prompt-tuned Vision-Language Model to convert noisy raw text into normalized, structured JSON schemas.
impact: Reduced manual QA and data-entry time by ~40% in sample workflows.
Created a modular pipeline that can adapt to new drawing templates with minimal retraining.

projects.title: Talking Head & Lip Sync Generation
projects.problem: Generate realistic lip-synced talking head videos conditioned on speech while maintaining identity consistency and smooth motion.
approach: Implemented and compared GAN-based and transformer-based audio-visual alignment architectures.
Introduced sequence discriminators and feature matching losses to improve temporal consistency and reduce artifacts.
impact: Improved lip-sync quality measured via LSE-C/LSE-D metrics.
Conducted small-scale user studies demonstrating more natural motion and lip alignment compared to baseline methods.

publications.title: Curriculum Guided Massive Multi Agent System Solving For Robust Long Horizon Tasks
publications.abstract: Large Language Models and multi-agent systems have shown promise in decomposing complex tasks, yet they struggle with long-horizon reasoning tasks and escalating computation cost. This work introduces a hierarchical multi-agent architecture that distributes reasoning across a 64×64 grid of lightweight agents, supported by a selective oracle. A spatial curriculum progressively expands the operational region of the grid, ensuring that agents master easier central tasks before tackling harder peripheral ones. To improve reliability, the system integrates Negative Log-Likelihood as a measure of confidence, allowing the curriculum to prioritize regions where agents are both accurate and well-calibrated. A Thompson Sampling curriculum manager adaptively chooses training zones based on competence and NLL-driven reward signals.
contributions: Hierarchical multi-agent architecture distributing reasoning across a 64×64 grid of lightweight agents
Spatial curriculum learning that progressively expands operational regions from easier to harder tasks
NLL-based confidence measurement for prioritizing training on well-calibrated regions
Thompson Sampling curriculum manager for adaptive training zone selection
Demonstrated improved stability, reduced oracle usage, and stronger long-range reasoning on Tower of Hanoi benchmark
